alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Canyon Ferry Area; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Fergus County below 4500ft; Gallatin Valley; Gates of the Mountains; Helena Valley; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Madison River Valley; Meagher County Valleys; Missouri Headwaters; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains; Southern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 21 at 5:22PM MDT until October 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY TO 6 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, with locally higher amounts near terrain. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and southwest Montana. * WHEN...From 6 PM Saturday to 6 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult.
info.instruction: Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
